messages.subject: DEAR FRIEND,
messages.body:
Fri, 05 May 2006




Received: from smtp2.oi.com.br ()

MADUKA PETERS CHAMBERS 
BARRISTER AND SOLICITOR-AT-LAW) 
1095 EAGLEHOUSE CRESENT V/L 
MARINA LAGOS.-NIGERIA. 
Private Email:maduka_peters07@yahoo.com 

DEAR FRIEND, 

How are you today?I know this mail may come as a surprise to you due to the notable fact that you do not know me. Let me proceed by introducing my self formally to you. 

My name is Barrister Maduka Peters. I am from Nigeria and also a citizen of Great Britain and Northern Ireland as well as a practicing lawyer in the British bar. I am the legal representative to the late Mr. David Guglielmino,a National of your country and a resident of the United Kingdom for 8 years before he moved to Nigeria,and herein after would be referred to as my late client. 

My Late client moved to Nigeria on the 4th of august 1993 he also persuaded me to move with him as well with an agreement that he would be paying me monthly as his legal adviser since I was not at that time authorized to practice here in Nigeria. Since then I have lived with my late client in Nigeria and he has been paying my wages until Sunday the 2nd of February 2003 when my late client his wife and kids we killed in the bomb blast which happen in Lagos, please kindly find details of this incident at the web link below: 

<<http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/africa/2718295.stm>> 

Since then I have been trying to survive in Nigeria not knowing where to begin from if I return to the U.k.Before my clients death he was the CEO of atlas dredging company, this he made a lot of money from and had a lot of estates as well as an account with a bank in Nigeria here. 

He had an account with the Standard Investment Trust Bank valued at us$14.5 million which he did not fix any beneficiary or next of kin. I was told by this bank to provide his next of kin so that the proceeds of his account with them could be paid to whom I present as His next of kin.
 
For two years now I have been looking for his next of kin with no success until last week Friday when I received a notice from the bank that I am to produce the next of kin or have the account confiscated and the funds transferred to state treasury. 

I am now contacting you to present you as the next of kin to my late client so the proceeds of his account can be paid to you then both of us can share the money as follows , 40% for you 50% for me then 10% would be set aside for expenses we might incur during this transaction. 

I also wish to inform you that this transaction would be concluded in less than 10 working days from the date of your response as long as you co-operate fully. All proceedings in this transaction would be carried out legally thereby protecting you and me from any breach of the law.
 
If you are interested and ready to proceed in this transaction with me which I assure you that all is mapped out and I would give you full legal support and documented backup to buttress any claims we may make. 

Kindly get back to me if interested via my private email address [maduka_peters07@yahoo.com with the below in formations filled out. 

1.FULL NAME...............................  
2.DATE OF BIRTH............................  
3.SEX................  
4.MARITEL STATUS...........................  
5.CONTACT ADDRESS...........................  
6.OCUPPATION................................  
7.CALL PHONE NUMBER..........................  
8.ZIP CODE.............................  
9.FAX.......................................  
11.COUNTRY................................  

Best regards & Wishes  
Barr. Maduka Peters.  

CONFIDENTIALITY NOTE: This e-mail and any attachments may be confidential or contain privileged information. If you are not the intended recipient, be aware that any disclosure, copying, distribution or use of this e-mail or any attachment is prohibited. If you have received this e-mail in error,please notify us immediately by returning it to the sender and delete this copy and any attachments from your system.  

Thank you for your cooperation.

May 9, 2006

Mr. Peters,

I suppose if you just want me to receive and hold your money in my account then I guess I can help you out. However, I don't understand why you would offer me forty percent of $14.5 million just to do that and I would like clarification. You also mentioned that you have set aside ten percent (or $1.45 million) for expenses that might be incurred during the transfer. That's a lot of expenses, my friend. Just what exactly are you anticipating in the way of expenses?

The information you requested is indicated below. Once you have fully answered my questions above I will give you a final answer on my involvement.

1.FULL NAME - Lewis D. Noogie 
2.DATE OF BIRTH -  
3.SEX - Male. 
4.MARITAL STATUS - Divorced 
5.CONTACT ADDRESS - c/o Pizdyets Hotel and Resort, 7 Otyebis Prospect, Gadyukina, Kurgan Oblast, Russian Federation.

8.ZIP CODE - 136000 
9.FAX - N/A

Sincerely, 
Lewd

messages.body:
Tue, 9 May 2006

Dear Lewis,

I have just received your email and this come as good news to me. You shall in no way regret doing this business with me.

You must understand that you are going to be my partner and will play a major role in assisting me claim the funds from the bank. I cannot afford to be greedy as offering you any less would be outright stupidity since without your help, I cannot claim the funds. You must also realize that since I am putting a lot of trust in you because you will be the one receiving the funds and not me. We need each other to make this a success and we shall both need to assist each other and make trust our watchword.

I told you that 10% will be set aside for the expenses and want you to know that whatever is incurred by both of us in the course of this transaction will be reimbursed after the successful completion of this transaction. I cannot tell if my statistics are correct but i am thinking it might rise as much as 10% of the total sum as we have to make arrangements for tax the Russian Government will require.

This transaction shall bring joy and success to both of us and I want you seeing the mutual benefits we both stand to get. I trust you with the details of this transaction because I have no other option. I will call you in a few minutes time.

You can however reach me on my 24 hr mobile number: -240-1919

I hope to hear soonest from you and when finally i get your final nod, I will inform the bank of my success in locating the next of kin of my late client and also let you know the next step.

I hope to talk to you soon.

Your Partner, 
Mr. Peters

messages.body:
May 9, 2006

Mr. Peters,

While I think you could have found someone for much less to handle this money for you, if this is what you want to do then it's alright by me. I do, however think you can revise your estimate on expenses much lower. There is no tax on money brought into Russia.

No one here at the hotel said anything about someone trying to contact me. Most of the personnel manning the switchboard speak some English, with one or two exceptions. I'll try and find out today who took the call.

I guess the question now is what do we do next?

Lewd

Please fill the form and send to the bank via email or fax. The director is aware that you will be contacting him any moment from now. Plus the bank has recently had a merger with another bank and goes by the name African Continental Bank Plc.

Do follow my instructions religiously and carefully so my well perfected modalities can allow us have a smooth and hitch free transaction.

Your Partner,
Barrister Peters

Dear Lewis,

I have received your email and will want you to send the email you received from the bank to make sure there are no mistakes made. I am delighted to have heard from you positively and will make plans immediately to get the documents obtained.

The letter of administration Certificate from the probate office and Affidavit of claim certificates are legal documents which is required for you to obtain here in Nigeria before you can be legally recognized as the rightful beneficiary of the funds at the bank. These documents will automatically place you as the true heir and will act as change of beneficiary documents from my late client in your favour. I will move tomorrow to obtain the death certificate which will cost me $850.00 US Dollars. I will also make enquiry as to the cost of obtaining the legal change of beneficiary documents ( Affidavits of Claim Certificate and Letter of Administration Certificates from The probate office of the Federal Ministry of Justice Lagos.

Please let me have the email you received from the bank and kindly ensure that i have all future correspondences you make with the bank.

I will update you on enquiries made and send you the death Certificate after obtaining it. We have to work closely and co-cooperatively for the success of this transaction.

Thank you.
Barrister Peters.

messages.body:
May 14, 2006

Maduka,

$3,250 and $1,500 to obtain a couple of documents?!? Maduka, my friend, I smell a rat here. I think someone is trying to hose us on this deal!

I have obtained a lot of official documents, from many countries,  in my time but nothing ever cost me that much!! Let me make a suggestion - whoever is quoting you these prices, ask to speak to their supervisors. I think that the prices will quickly come down! Do this before you do something like taking out a loan on your house! That's the last thing I want you to have to do. This is ridiculous!

You are obviously new to this kind of transaction and it's a good thing you found me to help out on this. Do this - ask to speak to supervisors and always ask for invoices. That way, if someone is trying to screw us we will always be able to go back and reclaim the difference.

Keep me informed on what happens.

Lewd

messages.body:
May 19, 2006

Maduka, 

Good to hear from you my friend.

We have a lot to do to get ready for you to come here. I'll make arrangements here at the hotel for you and your family so you don't have to worry about that. Once we settle on your arrival date I will fly to Moscow to meet you and bring you here.

Getting visas for you and your family has now become urgent. If you do it through the nearest Russian Consulate it will take up to two months. Fortunately I have a contact in the Russian Immigration office who can speed things up considerably. I'll have to give him a small 'gift' for his help but it's the quickest way to get it done.

I emailed him yesterday and he sent me the attached visa application forms. Fill one of these out for yourself and each family member, then scan and return to me with a passport photo of each family member. You need to get those back to me early next week so I can get Boris started on your visas. Be sure to fill these forms out completely - The Russians are absolutely anal about their visa forms and one mistake or omission will require you to do it again.

I don't want to be in a position where your money is here and you are not so do get these to me early next week.

Have a nice weekend. 
Lewd

messages.body:

Maduka, 

This is really simple and I'm going to try and explain it as simply as I can.

You are exactly correct - if I don't bring your money here there's no reason for you to come here. However, I see no reason at this time why I will not be able to get your money here. Assuming I can get your money here, you and your family will need visas to come here. You cannot come to Russia without a visa.

The visa will cost money, as well as a little something extra for my friend in Russian Immigration to expedite it, but it will cost you nothing. I will take care of the cost. All you have to do is fill out the forms and send them to me with your passport photos. 

Once you have the visas, if for some reason I am not able to bring your money here, then nothing is lost except what I pay for the visas. If I do not get your money here, you do not have to come. You do understand this, correct?

Bottom line, we have to assume you are coming to Russia, therefore you will need VISAS!! If you are serious about finishing this transaction then please send me the completed visa forms NOW so we can get this part finished. If you continue to refuse to apply for a visa then you don't need me for this. Maduka,  integrity is my middle name. I will not have a situation where your money is here and you are not.

I hope you understand ME. 
Lewd

Fri, 2 Jun 2006

Dear Lewd, 

I have just been able to check my email. Kindly this regard the email you received. It is a well calculated attempt to disrupt our transaction and possibly find out information that could help divert our funds. i sacked my secretary because I found out that she hacked into my email address and for this reason i had my email address change to maduka_peters200@yahoo.com. I no longer felt safe with her as this transaction involves millions of dollars that could totally break me down should I carelessly throw caution to the wind.

I am 100% sure that she is the one who has written this letter to you to obviously cause confusion and also aide her in obtaining relevant information that would be used to have our funds diverted. a lot of things are happening in our world today and I would not want a situation where by we are careless and lose all we have worked so hard for.

I have deviced a code and if you do not find this code in future correspondences, kindly ignore the message. If you have done really well by informing me of this and I will be calling a friend who is a police officer to carry out an investigation on this note. The code is Rowland and you will find it at the top left corner of all future email sent to you by me.

I hope you have a lovely weekend and please let me know what is going on with the bank. You have to be very careful hence forth and on no account must you respond to that email address. You have to be careful with information revealed to people because we cannot afford to have any stones unturned. My sick daughterÕs health depends on the success of this transaction and my whole world would be ruined should anything evil befall us in our mission to claim the funds. I hope you understand me. A word they say is enough for the wise.

Your Partner,
Barrister Peters

messages.body:
Maduka & Peter (Okonkwo),

I must apologize for my last letter and it's complete lack of professionalism. I can only say that I was caught up in the anger of having nearly been the victim of a scam that could have potentially cost me a lot of money, and I would like to terminate our business relationship on a kinder, gentler, friendlier note:

Fulk you guys!

You jerkoffs haven't heard the last from me, not by a longshot. I'm still tempted to come down there and personally touch a whip to your flanks in the middle of the village square. It is only because I have some important meetings in Irkutsk next week that I am prevented from doing so.

Homes, you have awakened a sleeping 5'-4", 127 lb. giant and filled him with a terrible resolve. I'm going to devote myself to, uh, unmodality-ing your modalities. Ok, I'm not sure if 'unmodality-ing' is a real word but you get my drift. My Supergeek is on the case and on your asses!

Your pal, 
Lewd

Received: from smtp2.oi.com.br ()

MADUKA PETERS CHAMBERS 
BARRISTER AND SOLICITOR-AT-LAW) 
1095 EAGLEHOUSE CRESENT V/L 
MARINA LAGOS.-NIGERIA. 
Private Email:     maduka_peters07@yahoo.com

DEAR,

How are you today?I know this mail may come as a surprise to you due to the notable fact that you do not know me. Let me proceed by introducing my self formally to you.My name is Barrister Maduka Peters. I am from Nigeria and allso a citizen of Great Britain and Northern Ireland as well as a practicing lawyer in the British bar.

I am the legal representative to the late Mr. David Peterson,a National of your country and a resident of the United Kingdom for 8 years before he moved to Nigeria,and herein after would be referred to as my late client. My Late client moved to Nigeria on the 4th of august 1993 he also persuaded me to move with him as well with an agreement that he would be paying me monthly as his legal adviser since I was not at that time authorized to practice here in Nigeria. Since then I have lived with my late client in Nigeria and he has been paying my wages until Sunday the 2nd of February 2003 when my late client his wife and kids we killed in the bomb blast which happen in Lagos, please kindly find details of this incident at the web link below:

<<http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/africa/2718295.stm>>

   Since then I have been trying to survive in Nigeria not knowing where to begin from if I return to the U.k.Before my clients death he was the CEO of atlas dredging company, this he made a lot of money from and had a lot of estates as well as an account with a bank in Nigeria here.

He had an account with the Standard Investment Trust Bank valued at us$14.5 million which he did not fix any beneficiary or next of kin. I was told by this bank to provide his next of kin so that the proceeds

of his account with them could be paid to whom I present as His next of kin.

For two years now I have been looking for his next of kin with no success until last week Friday when I received a notice from the bank that I am to produce the next of kin or have the account confiscated

and the funds transferred to state treasury.

I am now contacting you to present you as the next of kin to my late client so the proceeds of his account can be paid to you then both of us can share the money as follows , 40% for you 50% for me then 10% would be set aside for expenses we might incure during this transaction.

I also wish to inform you that this transaction would be concluded in less than 10 working days from the date of your response as long as you co-operate fully. All proceedings in this transaction would be carried out legally thereby protecting you and me from any breach of the law.

If you are interested and ready to proceed in this transaction with me which I assure you that all is mapped out and I would give you full legal support and documented backup to buttress any claims we may make.Kindly get back to me if interested via my private email address [maduka_peters07@yahoo.com with the below in formations filled out.

1.FULL NAME...............................

5.CONTACT ADDRESS...........................

6.OCUPPATION................................

7.CALL PHONE NUMBER..........................

11.COUNTRY................................

Best regards & Wishes

Barr.Maduka Peters

attachment is prohibited. If you have received this e-mail in error,please notify us immediately by returning it to the sender and delete this copy and any attachments from your system.

Thank you for your cooperation.

I hope to hear from you very soon!

Love, 
Maya

messages.subject: Hello again
messages.body:
(to Fraud Alert Department)

June 7, 2006

Mrs. Okonta,

It is so nice to have another woman on my side in this, I feel better already. Thank you very much for your help and support.

It was reassuring to know that Mr. Lukman and Mr. Oghene are employees of your bank. I feel more confident now.

Per your instruction, I am enclosing the text of another email I received from Lewis Noogie this afternoon:

 
Hello, Maya, 
 
I owe you an apology, Maya. In my continuing efforts to track down the scammers who are preying 
upon you I hacked into your computer again last night. I stumbled upon some pictures you have stored on your hard-drive and I enjoyed looking at them very much. You are a very attractive girl, Maya, and again my apologies for intruding into your personal information.

 
I found one letter in your email inbox from your company and I see you work as an administrative 
assistant. As I don't know you very well, I'm going to take a giant risk here - how would you like to 
come work for me in Russia? I think you would like it here in Gadyukina very much, although you 
would also get to travel all over the country as well as the other Eastern European countries. I would 
be happy to provide you with more details and we can talk about salary before you leave to come 
here. 
 
If you're interested, call me at 7-495-964-8597 and I'll answer any questions you have. If you decide you want to try it I will arrange to have a first-class plane ticket for you to pick up at the airline of your choice.

 
Again, Maya, I beg you not to respond to those scammers who are trying to steal your money. Go get your money back from Western Union and use it to buy new clothes to come here.

 
Looking forward to hearing from you. 
Lewis Noogie 


I have to admit, woman-to-woman, that he sounds very nice and sincere. I guess part of the problem I have with Mr. Peters is that he came on very nice at first but he doesn't want me to come to meet him, even after I begged him to let me come. Don't you just get so tired of MEN sometimes? He is only interested in the money he is going to make. Mr. Noogie is even offering me a first-class plane ticket. If the circumstances were different I would jump at the chance to work in a place like Russia.

Any advice you have to offer will be greatly appreciated. I need to come to a final decision very soon.

Maya

messages.body:
June 7, 2006

Maduka,  you're not a woman so you would not understand. When you and I first started corresponding and you were saying all those nice things, I was ready to come to Nigeria then and there. It was going to be so good to get out of West Dakota and start an adventure with a man who I thought might actually care about me.  And then what do you tell me? Don't come! It's too stressful! We don't have time!

Horse puckey.

If I had come there when I wanted to we would have had this over and done with. You only wanted me to get this money so you could take your share and disappear. You know it, I know it. Have you noticed that you have not written to me one time just to see how I am or what am I doing? Every letter you write it's only 'contact the bank', or 'have you talked to the bank yet'? That money is all you're interested in.

And what is this, 'you told me not to write to him or hear from him or listen to him anymore'? Maduka, who do you think you are, my boss? You can't tell me what to do. If you had asked me to come to you when I said I wanted to, THEN you could have given me orders and I would have followed them, but not now. I can talk to, listen to, or do things to, anyone I want.

I'm probably still going to help you get the money but I want to hear what Patience Okonta has to say first. At least I can talk to her and know she not interested in me helping her get money.

I'll let you know when I hear from her.

Maya

Patience,

You never told me you were pregnant, sister! That's great!! I am truly honored that you are going to name her after me! Many congratulations!

But I think I have some bad news. If you're 8 months and 2 weeks along, they are not going to let you fly, especially for a trip from Nigeria to the US. I had a friend who was at 7 and a half months and they would not let her on a plane either. Flight crews only like to serve coffee, they don't like delivering babies. Besides, I am giving up my apartment at the end of this month, otherwise I'd love to let you stay here.

I checked my email and then I remembered I don't have the automatic-save-sent-message thingy turned on. I turned it off like a year ago because sometimes I would send email to old boyfriends after I had too much to drink and it was too embarassing to re-read them the next morning.

Patience, I'm sure that Mr. Oghene has all the Western Union stuff. I would be very surprised if he hasn't already picked up the money.

Listen girlfriend, you better quit working and start getting ready for your delivery. You're at the stage where things could pop at any minute. Don't worry about writing until you're through this and then be sure to send me some pictures. I want to see what my little namesake looks like.

Gotta run, so many things to do today. More later.

Maya

Patience,

There's something funny about Mr. Oghene. How can he refuse to do something like this? Why doesn't somebody fire him?

I'm very surprised to hear that the $850 was not picked up, that's very good news. I'll get over to the Western Union office in the next couple of days to recover it. Lewis sent me some money for moving but the $850 will come in handy.

I have to admit I was confused at first as to why you would want me to resend the money in your name but then I realized that Maduka probably didn't tell you that I'm no longer involved in this transaction. I told him some time ago that I was out after he started blaming me for everything that was going wrong and how long it was taking. That's just the kind of thing you would expect from a man, isn't it? Something goes wrong and the first thing they do is look for somebody else to blame. Men are dogs!

How are you feeling today? I've never been pregnant before but I can imagine how it must feel being this close to delivery. You really shouldn't be working, you know.

I have to stop here, another busy day ahead. Thanks again for everything, Patience.

Maya

This was fun, wasn't it? I mean, once I found out that you were trying to hose me on this deal and I had my geek hack your computer, it's been a real ride ever since, da?

Your pal,
